result.execSummary:
The defendant William C. Hamm IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court
Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the officer due within 30 days and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall obtain his GED/HSED or diploma through the adult diploma program.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence is to begin immediately.  

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
The fine and costs are reduced to a civil judgment and are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning 30 days after release from custody.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The costs are to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning October 9, 2015.

Defendant William C. Hamm in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant William C. Hamm in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  State moves to amend count 1 to Resisting a Traffic Officer by Failing to Stop 346.04(2t).  Plea of no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 2.  The court  orders count 1 withheld sentence probation for one year with conditions of $100.00 fine plus court costs; DNA sample and DNA surcharge; 60 days county jail with huber  beginning November 9, 2015 at 4:30 p.m. ; letter of apology to the officer due within 30 days and preapproved by probation; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; obtain; GED/HSED or adult diploma program.  61 days sentence credit   Count 2 - court orders court costs and DNA surcharge.  Payment plan of $50.00 a month beginning October 9, 2015.
Days Credit Worksheet
to William C. Hamm IV - Notice of Hearing - no forwarding address
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-09-2015 01:45 pm
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

ADR began at 1:04 p.m.  Defendant William C. Hamm in court, in custody with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Defendant waives the time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Pretrial conference scheduled.   Attorney Nocco requested bond be amended.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Court denies request to amend bond.  Court continues bond as previously ordered.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  ADR ended at 1:10 p.m.  - rt

Defendant William C. Hamm in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Hamm wrote a letter to the court requesting a bond modification hearing.  Statement by parties.  Court denies defendant's request to amend the bond.  - rt
Letter from defendant
Bond Modification Hearing on 7-27-2015 at 10:30 a.m.
Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.
Initial Appearance on 8-11-15 at 1:00 p.m.
Arrest Report

ADR began at 1:39 p.m.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William Hamm appeared in court, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $1,000.00 cash bond and booking.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant indicated that his mail goes to Buttnernut but that he physical address is Owen.  Court orders a $500.00 cash bond and $1,000.00 signature bond and booking.  ADR ended at 1:43 p.m.  - rt
